etymology.description: Depicts the sun -> dot/line added for distinction
etymology.interpretation: The character 日(日) (rì, "sun") represents the sun, and its form reflects this by resembling a circle with a central dot or line, akin to historical symbols for the sun across cultures.

examples.chinese: 日光洒满大地(日光灑滿大地)。
当日西沉时(當日西沉時)，晚霞映红天际(晚霞映紅天際)。
examples.pinyin: Dāng rì xī chén shí, wǎn xiá yìng hóng tiānjì.
examples.english: When the sun sets in the west, the evening glow colors the horizon.
